connectionId: Id of the connection that provides the song
serviceType: The type of service that provides the song
name: Name of song
id: whatever unique identifier the service provides

artists.name: Name of artist
artists.id: service's unique identifier for the artist

album.name: Name of album
album.id: service's unique identifier for the album

artists.name: Name of artist
artists.id: service's unique identifier for the artist

album.image: source url of the album art

image: source url of image unique to the song, if one does not exist this will be the album art or in the case of videos the thumbnail
audio: source url of the audio stream
video: source url of the video stream (if this is not null then player will allow for video mode, otherwise use image)
releaseDate: Either the date the MV was upload or the release date/year of the album
All of the above data: Is comprised solely of data that has been read from the respective service and processed by a factory
the above data should not contain or rel: save for the data that was read to fetch it in the first place (connectionId, serviceType, etc.)
data that requires something else to be: should not be implemented into any visual design and is to be fetched as needed
When it comes to determining whether or: This is determined solely by the presence of a video source url, which will automatically be null for all sources besides youtube obviously
If a song does have a video source, it w: The presence of this property will likely determine certain styling, as well as the presence of the song/video switcher in the player
